job_description:
One of India's fastest growing consumer health startups Clinikally is looking for someone who has solid mobile engineering fundamentals, can help build winning cross-platform mobile apps and thrive amidst a dynamic team. This internship offers an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience in software fundamentals while contributing to a first of its kind e-commerce and telehealth platform focused on dermatology (â†’ with potential full-time upon completion).
Responsibilities 
Build high quality mobile apps from scratch in a lean team for iOS and Android
Collaborate with senior developers to implement responsive and accessible designs across mobile platform.
Participate in coding, testing, and debugging of mobile applications
Learn and apply best practices in front-end and mobile development
Document code and maintain technical documentation
Understanding of RESTful APIs and how to integrate them in mobile apps
Seamless communication and ownership are musts!
Requirements
Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Mobile App Development, or a related field
Strong foundation in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Familiarity with modern front-end frameworks (e.g., React, Vue.js, or Angular)
Prior internships in mobile engineering is a must
Previously built high quality mobile apps in production-grade environments
Good understanding of native Android/iOS development - writing work bridges, etc.
Can build high quality UI and UX flows
What We Offer
Hands-on experience in real-world development environments & production-ready projects
Mentorship from experienced developers specializing in all technologies
Exposure to both e-commerce and healthcare industries
Opportunity to work on mobile technologies
Flexible work hours to accommodate your academic schedule
Potential for full-time employment upon successful completion of the internship, along with bonus on release.
Duration: [
    6-9 months
  ]
To apply, please submit your resume, a note explaining your interest in this position, and any relevant portfolio or project examples (including any mobile apps you've worked on, even if they're academic projects).
